meanings.definition: In a manner relating to the study of changes in organisms caused by modification of gene expression rather than alteration of the genetic code.
meanings.sent1: She epigenetically altered the gene expression in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied how traits can be passed down epigenetically.
meanings.sent3: The plant epigenetically decided to bloom early, surprising the gardener.
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the project was epigenetically significant, like a hidden force.
meanings.sent5: The concept of epigenetically changing traits fascinated the biology students.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves changes in gene activity that do not involve alterations to the DNA sequence.
meanings.sent1: The medication epigenetically affected the gene activity in the patient.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are exploring how traits can be inherited epigenetically.
meanings.sent3: The cat epigenetically chose to nap in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: His words had an epigenetically calming effect on her, like a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The idea of epigenetically influencing behavior intrigued the psychology class.
